confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at approximately 14:50 local time on 26 November 2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Taiâ€¯Po, Hongâ€¯Kong.
The complex had 2,000 units and housed about 4,800 residents; 7 of 8 blocks were engulfed.
A maintenance bamboo scaffold was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s rapid spread.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
Firefighters rated the incident as a 5â€‘level (maximum) fire and are still conducting rescue operations.
No Korean nationals were reported among the casualties.

timeline.event: Fire started at ~14:50 local time in Taiâ€¯Po highâ€‘rise apartment complex.
Firefighters reported 13 deaths (including one firefighter) and ~10 injuries.
Fire classified as 5â€‘level (maximum) and rescue operations underway.
No Korean casualties reported by the Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
